byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By ELISABETH MALKIN and ALBERTO ARCE

abstract: Case files in assassinations of top Honduran drug officials Julian Aristides Gonzalez Irias and Alfredo Landaverde Hernandez in 2009 and 2011 show killings were ordered by cell of high-ranking police commanders in collusion with drug traffickers; disclosure has shaken country and presents glaring example of top-level government corruption.
lead_paragraph: New documents paint a chilling portrait of impunity at the very top of Honduras’s police hierarchy: the unchallenged power to carry out assassinations.

headline.main: Files Suggest Honduran Police Leaders Ordered Killing of Antidrug Officials
headline.print_headline: Files Suggest Police Leaders Ordered Killings of Antidrug Officials in Honduras

snippet: New documents paint a chilling portrait of impunity at the very top of Honduras’s police hierarchy: the unchallenged power to carry out assassinations.
